thread.title: World markets drop after bleak Chinese industry report
thread.title_full: World markets drop after bleak Chinese industry report

title: World markets drop after bleak Chinese industry report
text:
gallery_overlay_open_thumbs|article-gallery-6475932|article-gallery-6475932|0 Image 1 of 1 
This Aug. 24, 2015, photo shows the facade of the New York Stock Exchange. Global stock markets fell sharply Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2015, and Wall Street was set to open lower as gloomy economic data from China and Japan augured further uncertainty for investors after a brutal August. Photo: Seth Wenig, AP This Aug. 24, 2015, photo shows the facade of the New York Stock... World markets drop after bleak Chinese industry report 1 / 1 gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6475932|article-gallery-6475932|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6475932|article-gallery-6475932|0 NEW YORK (AP) â€” More signs of weakness in China's economy are sending global stock markets sharply lower. The early swoon Tuesday comes a day after U.S. stocks closed out their worst month in more than three years. The Dow Jones industrial average fell 335 points, or 2 percent, to 16,200 as of 9:35 a.m. Eastern time. The Standard & Poor's 500 fell 37 points, or 1.9 percent, to 1,935. The Nasdaq slid 82 points, or 1.7 percent, to 4,695. Benchmark indexes were down 2.6 percent in Germany and 3 percent in Britain. Japan's Nikkei fell 4 percent. An official index of Chinese manufacturing fell to a three-year low last month. The signs of weakness in China, a major importer of oil, sent the price of crude skidding 4 percent.
